title: binary fails inside docker container at start up on centos 8

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Stuff to do at some later date

body:
Hi,

I try to run the binary distribution inside docker and it fails. If I run it outside docker it all works fine.

Here is how to reproduce on centos 8:

```
FROM centos:8

ENV VERSION=0.3.4
ENV HOME="/data"
ENV PATH /usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/root/bin

RUN curl -L -o /usr/bin/beacon-chain https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/releases/download/v$VERSION/beacon-chain-v$VERSION-linux-amd64 && \
	chmod 755 /usr/bin/beacon-chain && \
    chmod 755 /usr/bin/uid_entrypoint && \
    mkdir /data && chmod 777 /data && \
    chmod g=u /etc/passwd

VOLUME /data

WORKDIR /data

EXPOSE 4000/tcp
EXPOSE 13000/tcp

CMD /usr/bin/beacon-chain \
    --init-sync-no-verify \
	--p2p-port=4000 \
	--grpc-gateway-port=13000 \
    --datadir=/data
```

The output is when running `docker run -it --user 0 localhost/test:latest`


Hi, found out it is way simpler to reproduce under centos 8.

```
[root@False beacon]# docker run -it -v $HOME/prysm:/data -p 4000:4000 -p 13000:13000 --name beacon-node   gcr.io/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain:latest   --datadir=/data
```

I think the BLS binaries were pre-compiled for ubuntu 18. We've seen issues with ubuntu 16 https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/issues/4691 as well which were resolved by using ubuntu 18. 

I'd recommend building from source with LLVM. This requires libgmp-dev installed on your system.

```
sudo apt-get install libgmp-dev # Unless you already have it

bazel run //beacon-chain --config=llvm -- --datadir=/path/to/datadir --otherflags --etc
```

Likewise with the validator
```
bazel run //validator --config=llvm -- --validator-flags
```

Here is my current progress. I gave up on bazel after it was failing with the `--output_base` param.

```
FROM centos:8

ENV VERSION=0.3.7

COPY bin/uid_entrypoint /usr/bin/uid_entrypoint

RUN dnf install -y 'dnf-command(config-manager)' && \
    dnf config-manager --add-repo https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/vbatts/bazel/repo/epel-8/vbatts-bazel-epel-8.repo && \
    dnf install -y bazel gmp-c++ gmp-devel unzip python36 git gcc patch gcc-c++

RUN curl -L -o source.zip https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/archive/v$VERSION.zip && \
    unzip source.zip && \
    cd prysm-$VERSION && bazel --output_base=release build //beacon-chain:beacon-chain  && \
    cp bazel-bin/validator/linux_amd64_stripped/beacon-chain /usr/bin/beacon-chain
```
Can you elaborate on the output base issue? Why override the default?

My progress so far
```dockerfile
FROM centos:8

ENV VERSION=0.3.7

#COPY bin/uid_entrypoint /usr/bin/uid_entrypoint


RUN dnf install -y 'dnf-command(config-manager)' && \
    dnf install -y gmp-c++ gmp-devel unzip python36 git gcc patch gcc-c++ go

# Install bazelisk as bazel. Bazelisk downloads the appropriate version of bazel as required by Prysm.
RUN export PATH=$PATH:$(go env GOPATH)/bin
RUN go get github.com/bazelbuild/bazelisk
RUN ln -s $(go env GOPATH)/bin/bazelisk /usr/bin/bazel

# Download prysm
RUN curl -L -o source.zip https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/archive/v$VERSION.zip && \
    unzip source.zip
WORKDIR prysm-$VERSION

# Build beacon-chain with llvm and release configuration.
RUN ./bazel.sh build --config=release --config=llvm //beacon-chain:beacon-chain

# Copy binary to /usr/bin
RUN cp $(bazel info bazel-bin)/beacon-chain/linux_amd64_stripped/beacon-chain /usr/bin/beacon-chain
```
@xrow is this still a valid issue?
Yes please stay tuned for 2 more weeks. I let you know.
@xrow what's your recommendation on how to proceed with this?

Hi,

I finally completed by build for the beacon chain. Is this something that can help you to build a proper centos release?

```
FROM centos:8

ENV VERSION=0.3.9
ENV TERM=linux
ENV LANG=en_US.UTF-8

COPY bin/uid_entrypoint /usr/bin/uid_entrypoint

RUN dnf install -y 'dnf-command(config-manager)' && \
    dnf install -y gmp-c++ gmp-devel unzip python36 git gcc patch gcc-c++ go ncurses-compat-libs

# Install bazelisk as bazel. Bazelisk downloads the appropriate version of bazel as required by Prysm.
RUN export PATH=$PATH:$(go env GOPATH)/bin
RUN go get github.com/bazelbuild/bazelisk
RUN ln -s $(go env GOPATH)/bin/bazelisk /usr/bin/bazel

# Download prysm
RUN curl -L -o source.zip https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/archive/v$VERSION.zip && \
    unzip source.zip
WORKDIR prysm-$VERSION

# Build beacon-chain with llvm and release configuration.
RUN ./bazel.sh build --config=release --config=llvm //beacon-chain:beacon-chain

# Copy binary to /usr/bin
RUN cp bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/beacon-chain/linux_amd64_stripped/beacon-chain /usr/bin/beacon-chain && \
    chmod 755 /usr/bin/beacon-chain

RUN	chmod 755 /usr/bin/uid_entrypoint && \
    mkdir /data && chmod 777 /data && \
    chmod g=u /etc/passwd

VOLUME /data

WORKDIR /data

EXPOSE 4000/tcp
EXPOSE 13000/tcp
EXPOSE 4001/tcp
EXPOSE 8080/tcp

CMD /usr/bin/beacon-chain --config-file=/etc/prysm/beacon-node.yaml

ENTRYPOINT [ "/usr/bin/uid_entrypoint" ]

USER 1001
```

At the moment, we provide the following docker images for beacon chain and validator binaries
- Minimal (default, go only image)
- Debug (built with debug symbols, additional tooling)
- Alpine (minimal build with an alpine base image)

Since we don't use traditional `Dockerfile`s to create docker images, can you help me understand what is missing from the three available flavors of docker images?

Hi,

our full stack is red hat based and sometimes supported. Therefore we like to run any software under a supported stack.
Alright, I suppose we can add another base to our docker image deployments for beacon-chain and validator.
Closing this as obsolete. We do not use herumi anymore for validator signing, so this issue should no longer be relevant.
